publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1614 Mr Stewart Maxwell: Loss of Scottish Teletext Servicesâ€”That the Parliament strongly disapproves of the actions of Teletext in ceasing the broadcast of a separate Scottish national news service with the incumbent loss of nine of the 14 jobs at present in their Glasgow office; recognises that this means a diminution of quality of service for Scotland, and urges Teletext to reconsider this move and to keep at least one Scottish editor in Glasgow to ensure that the Scottish Teletext service remains monitored and edited within Scotland and not from London, as will be the outcome of this proposal.
S2M-1614 Loss of Scottish Teletext Services (lodged on 17 August 2004) Ms Sandra White*

S2M-1614 Loss of Scottish Teletext Services (lodged on 17 August 2004) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Fergus Ewing*, Alex Neil*, Tommy Sheridan*, Jim Mather*, Linda Fabiani*, Stewart Stevenson*, Rosie Kane*, Patrick Harvie*, Carolyn Leckie*, John Swinburne*
S2M-1614 Loss of Scottish Teletext Services (lodged on 17 August 2004) Margo MacDonald*
S2M-1614 Loss of Scottish Teletext Services (lodged on 17 August 2004) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1614 Loss of Scottish Teletext Services (lodged on 17 August 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-1614 Loss of Scottish Teletext Services (lodged on 17 August 2004) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-1614 Loss of Scottish Teletext Services (lodged on 17 August 2004) Tricia Marwick*
